channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.dc:creator: Lauren Pilat
item.description: Health Minister Roger Cook introduced the new measures to limit the spread of the virus on Friday as WA recorded two new cases overnight; one a 45-year-old Perth man who returned home from Victoria on Wednesday.
item.title: Victorian arrivals to WA will have to fork out for their own quarantine: Health Minister

item.dc:creator: The Herald's View
item.description: The debate between suppression and elimination of the disease is premature when we are in the throes of a major outbreak.
item.title: Call the policy what you like but the goal is to stop COVID-19

item.dc:creator: Latika Bourke
item.description: The United States, United Kingdom and Canada say Russian "state sponsored actors" are hindering research efforts at the height of the pandemic.
item.title: Russia denies 'trying to steal' virus vaccine secrets

item.dc:creator: Max Allen
item.description: Even this self-confessed drinks snob retains a sentimental attachment to the iconic brand. Or is that just the beer talking?
item.title: How a day making VB brewed up more than a 'hard-earned thirst'

item.dc:creator: Jake Niall
item.description: Collingwood star Jordan De Goey will have finger surgery after suffering an injury during his starring five-goal performance in Thursday night's win over Geelong at Optus Stadium.
item.title: Magpies star De Goey to have finger surgery

item.dc:creator: Tom Decent
item.description: Tom Horton will make his NSW run-on debut against the Brumbies on Saturday evening just a few months after slaving away as a tradie.
item.title: The Waratahs chippie who hits like a 'freight train'

item.dc:creator: Dana McCauley
item.description: Alcohol bottles will display a prominent warning label outlining the dangers of drinking while pregnant, after politicians voted to make the new label mandatory.
item.title: Ministers approve mandatory alcohol pregnancy warning label

item.dc:creator: Craig Butt
item.description: More than 13.5 million people worldwide have contracted coronavirus, while the death toll currently stands at more than 586,000.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: Victoria records 428 new COVID-19 cases as NSW restrictions upgraded for pubs, weddings and funerals; Australian death toll jumps to 116

item.description: Everything you need to know to pick a winner on an nine-race card.
item.title: Race-by-race guide and tips for Randwick's Kensington track on Saturday

item.dc:creator: Peter Hannam
item.description: The Land & Environment Court has dismissed an injunction on the removal of feral horses from three regions of the Kosciuszko National Park.
item.title: NSW government to resume Kosciuszko brumby removal after court win

item.dc:creator: Garry Maddox
item.description: The federal government's announcement of $400 million to attract overseas production has pleased many - but not all - in the sector.
item.title: Film industry calls for more local support after Hollywood incentive

item.dc:creator: Adrian Proszenko
item.description: The Eels rookie is looking to make a bigger impact on the field - and less off it - in his second NRL game.
item.title: 'We just got too excited': Utoikamanu family to watch next Eels game from home

item.dc:creator: Rachel Eddie
item.description: Whitten Oval had been closed to the public even after the Bulldogs flew to Queensland. But the Footscray park will reopen for weekday mornings from Monday.
item.title: While the Dogs are away the locals can play after club reopens oval

item.dc:creator: Nigel Gladstone
item.description: Dee Why RSL is under strict conditions as regulators push for reforms following an investigation sparked by the suicide of a man who died after a poker machine binge at the club.
item.title: Sydney RSL club cops record penalty for 'high roller perks'

item.dc:creator: Peter FitzSimons
item.description: "This is a stark illustration of why we need to get serious about reducing exposure to head knocks in children’s sport."
item.title: Tragic twist in the tale of late, great NSW rugby coach

item.description: The changes are part of the transitional government's plan to lead the country to democracy after the toppling last year of autocrat Omar al-Bashir.
item.title: 'Great first step' as Sudan lifts death penalty and flogging for gay sex

item.dc:creator: Matt Dennien
item.description: Ten people have now been stung with $4003 fines since new laws came into effect as part of Queensland's efforts to block entry from COVID-19 hotspots.
item.title: Victorian fined after alleged third try at remote Qld border crossing

item.dc:creator: Chris Barrett
item.description: The owner of Australia's professional cycling team is looking towards next month's Tour de France after a bizarre near-takeover of the team he set up eight years ago.
item.title: 'It wasn't the deal I thought': How Gerry Ryan stopped the sale of GreenEdge to Spain

item.dc:creator: Jennifer Duke
item.description: Double Bay, Point Piper and Toorak are home to the country's biggest income earners, while the Mornington Peninsula's Portsea has been pushed off the rich list.
item.title: The 10 postcodes where Australia's highest income earners live

item.dc:creator: Adam Cooper
item.description: Victoria's first and only judge-only criminal trial has ended in not-guilty verdicts against a man and a woman accused of drug offences.
item.title: Victoria's first judge-only trial ends in not-guilty verdicts

item.dc:creator: Clancy Yeates
item.description: Westpac chief executive Peter King says the bank will work to set clear risk boundaries for decision making and provide extra training for staff.
item.title: Westpac boss vows action after risk culture found 'immature and reactive'

item.description: In the new normal, agents of change can be quiz that unifies families, a pot of coriander or algebra on the veranda.
item.title: Time to improvise: the 25 questions of COVID-19

item.dc:creator: Sarah Keoghan
item.description: The Souths coach said he was not concerned about the future of the code despite rising COVID-19 cases in Victoria and NSW.
item.title: 'Get on with it': Bennett says players unhappy with bubble have option to retire

item.dc:creator: Sally Rawsthorne
item.description: Coastal homes at Wamberal were hammered by large swell on Thursday, leaving several with apparent structural damage.
item.title: Wild weather leaves NSW homes at risk of 'structural collapse due to beach erosion'

item.dc:creator: Elizabeth Knight
item.description: Rio Tinto boss Jean-Jacques Sebastien didn’t rule out the possibility there would be consequences for the board and the executives over the company's destruction of a 46,000-year-old Indigenous cave site.
item.title: For Rio's boss, cave blast is a sore that keeps weeping

item.dc:creator: Adam Cooper
item.description: Man refused bail in April but County Court judge found the 29-year-old might not face trial until well into next year - an unprecedented wait.
item.title: Bail for accused rapist over 'extraordinary delay' before his trial

item.description: In the US, the Phoenix medical examiner’s office is stocking up on storage coolers for an influx of bodies as funeral homes hit maximum capacity.
item.title: New outbreaks raise alarm as India cases hit 1 million, Brazil 2 million

item.dc:creator: Dominic Bossi
item.description: In 12 months, the young Australian defender went from playing against superstars in Germany's Bundesliga to having a life-saving operation.
item.title: 'I could've dropped dead': Timotheou's journey from Schalke to heart surgery

item.dc:creator: Damien Ractliffe
item.description: Champion jockey Damien Oliver is being investigated for a potential coronavirus breach after he rode trackwork for Melbourne Cup-winning trainer Danny O’Brien at Barwon Heads on Friday morning.
item.title: Oliver stood down over potential biosecurity breach

item.dc:creator: Simone Fox Koob
item.description: Seven Victoria Police employees are suspended and six have been transferred to other duties as an investigation into the sharing of photos of former AFL coach Dean Laidley continues.
item.title: Thirteen Victoria Police employees suspended or transferred over Dean Laidley photos

item.dc:creator: Jake Wilson
item.description: In the midst of a pandemic, the cinema comes to you.
item.title: Best picks of new-look festival offering film feast at home

item.dc:creator: Jason Steger
item.description: Getting Elizabeth Harrower to Adelaide for a return visit to writers' week in 2017 was a memorable experience.
item.title: Bookmarks: Driving Ms Harrower - to Adelaide

item.description: The fitness circuit was like a panopticon. I had to escape.
item.title: The me I wanted to see has left the building

item.dc:creator: John McDonald
item.description: Planning a gallery crawl? Check out the shows from John R. Walker, Elisabeth Cummings, Ian Grant and Maria Kontis.
item.title: Four of the best: landscapes of the firegrounds and beyond

item.description: The official opening has been delayed by COVID-19, but Melburnians can still see what's going on beyond the Keith Haring mural.
item.title: Collingwood Yards, Melbourne's new arts hub, opens for digital tours

item.dc:creator: Barry Divola
item.description: Alice Ivy's Don't Sleep, Mark Isaacs' Robin Hood: the Film Music of Mark Isaacs, Chris Cody's Astrolabe and Samantha Crain's A Small Death.
item.title: Music reviews: Samantha Crain, Alice Ivy, Mark Isaacs and Chris Cody

item.description: The Victorian Premier inspires an unfamiliar sense of trust.
item.title: The strange feeling I have when I watch Daniel Andrews

item.dc:creator: Michael Dwyer
item.description: Malcolm McLaren was so much more than the manager of the Sex Pistols.
item.title: Who was the real Malcolm McLaren?

item.description: Heartbreak halted folk music icon Shirley Collins from singing for almost four decades. Now in her eighties, she is back and building on the pain of the past.
item.title: Folk singer Shirley Collins reclaims her "real" life

item.dc:creator: Stephanie Bunbury
item.description: The British writer's latest novel is set in a time when music was part of a push for political change.
item.title: David Mitchell and the search for when the times they were a-changin`

item.description: Kate Grenville breathes life into the figure of Elizabeth Macarthur.
item.title: Lessons from a real and imagined past life

item.description: When a house takes up most of the block, creativity and cunning are needed to soften the dominance.
item.title: Tricks of the trade: how to make the most of a garden of leftovers

item.description: Our pick of the exhibitions on show in Melbourne this weekend.
item.title: Around the galleries

item.dc:creator: Kerrie O'Brien
item.description: Children from the wealthiest families in the country are suffering, says parenting expert Steve Biddulph.
item.title: 'Rich kids are emotionally neglected': lunch with Steve Biddulph

item.dc:creator: Simone Fox Koob
item.description: Gabriel Messo, shot dead by police during a violent attack on his mother Lilla in Melbourne's north-west, was 'always angry' and prone to outbursts, according to his housemate.
item.title: 'Always angry': Man shot dead by police after frenzied attack on his mother in Gladstone Park

item.dc:creator: Anthony Galloway
item.description: Former prime minister Malcolm Turnbull says Scott Morrison never believed in a speech warning against "negative globalism", suggesting his successor was influenced by people in his office and right-wing commentators in the media.
item.title: 'Not Scott's view': Turnbull blasts Morrison's negative globalism speech

item.dc:creator: Timna Jacks
item.description: Police have fined five people who were found at a home in Melbourne's west as the government made it clear what locked-down Victorians are allowed to do.
item.title: Five fined at illegal brothel as government clarifies lockdown rules

item.dc:creator: Craig Butt
item.description: Using this interactive, you can see how total case numbers have shifted over time in Victorian local government areas.
item.title: How coronavirus case numbers have grown in Melbourne areas

item.dc:creator: Chris Barrett
item.description: A financial offer from the governing body is unlikely to abort a push for the governing body's board to be shaken up following an off-season crisis.
item.title: Cricket Australia fails to placate states as new deal backfires

item.description: Sydney-based artist Nicola Woodcock draws inspiration from the bush landscape that surrounds her home.
item.title: On my mind: artist Nicola Woodcock
